com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com the original sassy hat pattern difficulty easy but i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies  size n hook  one skein of 4 ply yarn red heart super saver works nicely or use a wool yarn for an even warmer hat  one skein of lion brand fun fur gauge 9 double_crochet to 4 inches and 3 row to 2 ½ inches one size fits most but hat may be big on small heads terms double_crochet = double_crochet increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch decrease = decrease crochet two stitches together to start each piece you can chain 4 slip_stitch to join and work your 12 stitches into the loop or you can use the magic_ring use variegated yarns change colors or make stripes be creative and have fun page 2 of 3 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com the original sassy hat row instruction stitches chain 4 slip_stitch to join and make a ring 1 12 double_crochet in loop try to crochet over the tail then pull tail tight if you can 12 making the circle smaller or just start out with a magic_ring and pull that tight 2 *2 double_crochet in each double_crochet* around 24 3 work even 24 4 *double_crochet in next 2 double_crochet increase in next double_crochet* around 32 5 work even 32 6 *double_crochet in next 3 double_crochet increase in next* around 40 7 work even 40 9 10 work even but decrease one stitch somewhere in the round 39 11 work even 39 12 repeat row 10 38 13 work even 38 slip_stitch to join last stitch and bind off weave in your tails both pieces of yarn make the pom-pom optional to make the pom-pom i use both strands of yarn as in the hat i wrap them longwise around my crochet hook case or you could use a book or piece of cardboard at least 4 inches long wrap 25 times and cut off at one end tie at the folded end or the middle and attach to the top of the hat be sure to tie both knots tight and use a square knot to make sure it stays put page 3 of 3 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com
